page.title: 20The Formby By-pass & Cycling
page.content:
The Formby By-pass (A565) carries many vehicles, including a frequent and well-used bus service from Southport to Freshfield. Its cycle track is little used because of broken glass. However bikes are popular, especially with children, for leisure because of the flat landscape.
**************************************
The co-ordinating school for this block of the Domesday Survey was Shoreside County Primary School, Ainsdale. We were assisted by St. Peter's C.of E. School, Formby, who contributed the information on St. Peter's Church, Woodvale Airfield and farming and the second page on the Freshfield shops.
